Views in Android development provide users with the buttons, images and other controls to navigate through the Android app. To create a footer view that aligns at the bottom of the screen, you must create a LinearLayout XML element and set the buttons in the layout with the layout_alignParentBottom property to true. Each Android app is designed in the Eclipse software, and you review your results in the Android emulator.
Ads by Google Recover/Repair Data Files We Recover 100% data from Lost Corrupted files. Free Analysis!www.stellarinfo.co.in​/​File-Recovery Step 1 Click the Windows "Start" button and type "eclipse.exe" in the search text box. Press "Enter" to locate the Eclipse executable. Double-click "eclipse.exe" to open the development software.
Step 2 Click the "res" directory to see a list of XML files that make up your menus. Double-click the XML file you want to use to display the menu.
Step 5 Save the file changes and click the Eclipse "Run" button to view the new view in the Android emulator.
